intro: Monochilus regius, commonly known as the royal monochilus, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from deep red to orange, often with a contrasting throat. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists alike.
